AT THAT TIME THE CREW APPEARS TO HAVE RUN THROUGH THE LAJ 6414 RIGID SWITCH (WHICH IS APPROXIMATELY 100 FEET FROM THE BANDINI CROSSING).  THE HELPER ON THE JOBINSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER TO SHOVE BACK INTO THE FACILITY TO SPOT TRACK 4601, WHEN THE CUT BEGAN TO MOVE BACKWARD AND STOPPED AFTER APPROXIMATELY 3 CAR LENGTHS (150 FEET).  THE CREW WENT BACK TO INVESTIGATE THE CAUSE OF THE CUT COMING TO A STOP AND FOUND THAT THEY HAD DERAILED.

THE CONDUCTOR WAS RIDING ON THE VERY LAST CAR OF A 5-PAK. AFTER THE CARS MOVED A SHORT DISTANCE THE TRAILING TRUCK OF 5-PAK, NOKL250414, STARTED TO GO TOWARD THE TRACK TO THE RIGHT WHILE THE REST OF THE TRAIN WAS GOING STRAIGHT.WHILE NOKL 250414 TRAVELED TO THE RIGHT IT SIDESWIPED 3 CARS ON DTTX 723928 (ANOTHER 5-PAK) THAT WERE PLACED ON TOP OF BLOCKS TOO CLOSE TO THE RAIL CAUSING EXTENSIVE DAMAGE. RIS INDUSTRIES IS A SELF SWITCHED FACILITY, THE INDUSTRY PERSONNEL HAD SHOVED 24 CARS ON TO THE OUTBOUND TRACK FOR CN TO PICKUP, DURING THE PROCESS OF PUTTING THE CARS ON THE OUTBOUND TRACK. RIS EMPLOYEES SHOVED 4 CARS THROUGH A SWITCH AND LEFT THE CARS ON TOP OF THE DAMAGED SWITCH. AS CN WENT TO PULL THE TRACK THE 5-PAK DERAILED AND SIDESWIPED THE 5-PAK STANDING ON ANOTHER TRACK.

D411410-d-11-15-10-BRS.Narrative: JOB 312 PULLED 20 CARS FROM 6 TRACK AND KICKED ONE CAR TO 9 TRACK AND THEN STARTED SHOVING 19 CARS BACK INTO 6 TRACK. THE REAR TRUCK OF THE 6TH CAR CLIMBED 1 TRACK SWITCH CAUSING THE FRONT HALF OF THECAR TO HEAD DOWN THE LEAD AND THE REAR HALF TO HEAD DOWN 1 TRACK. AS THEY WERE SHOVING ONE TRACK THE RAIL BROKE AS THE CAR WAS HEADING SIDEWAYS DOWN THE LEAD. THE MIDDLE OF THE 6TH CAR HIT THE FIRSTCAR IN 3 TRACK CAUSING DAMAGE TO IT AND TORE OPEN THE SIDE OF THE 6TH CAR, SPILLING A COMPARTMENT OFPLASTIC. AT THIS TIME THIS CONTACT CAUSED THE FRONT TRUCKS OF THE 5TH CAR TO DERAIL. THE SWITCH HADBEEN PREVIOUSLY DAMAGED - THE TEMPORARY REPAIR WAS TO SPIKE THE SWITCH. HOWEVER DUE TO THE BRIDGE ROD BEING DISCONNECTED, MULTIPLE MOVEMENTS OVER THIS SPIKED SWITCH ALLOWED FOR POINT MOVEMENT BOTHERHORIZONTALLY AND VERTICALLY CAUSING THE POINT TO EVENTUALLY GAP UNDER LOAD.

CO1110109-d-11-10-10-BNSF.Narrative: TRAIN STOPPED AT DED MP 603.6. INSPECTION FOUND THAT UNIT BNSF 7689 #5 TRACTION MOTOR WAS HANGING BELOW TOP OF RAIL. SUBSEQUENT MOW TRACK INSPECTION FOUND SIGNIFICANT DAMAGE TO SWITCHES AT SOUTH BAXTER AND NORTH AVONDALE. TRAIN DID NOT DERAIL. SEE ALSO CO-1110-108, FIRST INCIDENT THIS TRAIN.

1110DV004-d-11-08-10-UP.Narrative: AS THE CWEFN-08 FINISHED LOADING, THE LOADOUT OPERATOR TOLD CONDUCTOR THAT THE CHUTE WAS IN THE CLEAR AND IT WAS OK TO PULL OUT.  AFTER THE CONDUCTOR TOLD THE HEAD END TO START AHEAD HE HEARD THE OPERATOR YELL TO STOP.  THE CONDUCTOR THEN TOLD THE ENGINEER TO STOP.  THE ENGINEER THEN PUT TRAIN INTOEMERGENCY.  THE FIRST OF THE DPU LOCOMOTIVES (UP5918) STRUCK THE CHUTE AND IT BECAME WEDGED INTO THEROOF OF THE CAB.

1110DV006-d-11-10-10-UP.Narrative: WHILE NUMBER FIVE TRACTION MOTOR WAS DRAGGING EQUIPMENT, THE DETECTOR AT COLORADO SPRINGS WENT OFF AND THEY STOPPED AND INSPECTED AND FOUND NOTHING AND PROCEEDED.  IT APPEARED TO BE A BROKEN RAIL ANDDAMAGED SWITCHES FROM COLORADO SPRINGS TO KELKER, WHERE A BNSF CREW DRAGGED THEIR TRAIN APPROXIMATELY 68 MILES ON UNION PACIFIC MAINTAINED TRACK.  BNSF'S EQUIPMENT DAMAGE = $11,600.  RAIL = CWR

CO1110108-d-11-10-10-BNSF.Narrative: TRAIN STOPPED NEAR MP 84 AT DED, INSPECTION FOUND NTG. TRACK INDICATION REMAINED BEHIND TRAIN, MOW INSPN FOUND BROKEN RAIL AT MP 84.4 AND SIGNIFICANT DAMAGE TO SWITCH AT KELKER. TRAIN DID NOT DERAIL.SEE ALSO CO-1110-109, SECOND INCIDENT THIS TRAIN.

CRD1130101-d-11-30-10-IANR.Narrative: CREW WAS PULLING FORTY-FIVE CARS OF GRAIN WHEN TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY. AFTER THE TRAIN HAD STOPPED AN INSPECTION WAS MADE WHEREIN IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT A TOTAL OF 7 CARS WERE DERAILED. FURTHER INVESTIGATION SHOWED EVIDENCE THAT AN ADDITIONAL 10 CARS HAD BEEN DERAILED HOWEVER THE CARS RERAILED THEMSELVES IN A GRADE CROSSING. CONTRAY TO THE CIC CAUSE IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE CAUSE WAS DUE TO DEFECTIVE TIES CONDITIONS CAUSING WIDE GAGE. (CONTINUED ON SEPARATE SHEET)

1110CB001-d-11-04-10-UP.Narrative: KG1LA-04, WITH LEAD UNIT UP7859, STRUCK A SEMI TRUCK THAT WAS STUCK ON THE CROSSING.  THE DRIVER DEPARTED THE TRUCK PRIOR TO THE COLLISION WHEN THE CROSSING GATES ACTIVATED AND CAME DOWN ON THE TRUCK.WHEN THE TRAIN COLLIDED WITH THE TRUCK, THE TRUCK IGNITED INTO FLAMES AND WAS SHOVED APPROXIMATELY2700 FEET TO A STOP WHERE THE TRUCK BURNT TO THE FRAME RAILS.  NO INJURIES OCCURRED.  RAIL = CWR

1110CB002-d-11-05-10-UP.Primary Accident Cause: Failure to apply sufficient number of hand brakes on car(s) (railroad employee)
1110CB002-d-11-05-10-UP.Accident Cause: Failure to apply sufficient number of hand brakes on car(s) (railroad employee)
1110CB002-d-11-05-10-UP.Narrative: MMTCL-05 PULLED SIX RAILCARS FROM THE EAST END OF TRACK 18 IN BEVERLY RAILYARD TO SET ONE RAILCAR INTO TRACK 19 THEN COMPLETE THEIR SCHEDULED 33 RAILCAR PICKUP.  PRIOR TO PULLING OUT OF TRACK 18, THECONDUCTOR FAILED TO APPLY SUFFICIENT HANDBRAKES TO THE REMAINING 27 RAILCARS WHICH RESULTED IN THE UNCONTROLLED MOVEMENT OF THOSE RAILCARS.  THE CUT OF RAILCARS ROLLED INTO THE RAILCARS THE CREW WAS HANDLING, RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO TWO RAILCARS.  NO DERAILMENT OCCURRED.

1110CB008-d-11-12-10-UP.Narrative: MCBPR-12 WAS PULLING SIXTEEN RAILCARS FROM YARD TRACK ONE AT BEVERLY YARD.  THE ENGINEER FAILED TO RECOGNIZE THAT HE DID NOT HAVE A SIGNAL OR AUTHORITY TO ENTER MAIN TRACK ONE AND THAT THE SWITCHES AND DERAIL WERE NOT LINED FOR HIS MOVEMENT.  THE ENGINEER INITIATED AS EASTWARD MOVEMENT OVER THE DERAIL RESULTING IN THE DERAILMENT OF TWO LOCOMOTIVES.
